required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study Evaluating Clinical and Radiographic Early Outcomes of Total Hip Arthroplasty and Revision Hip Arthroplasty With DELTA Multihole TT Cup.

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective study evaluating clinical and radiographic early outcomes of total hip arthroplasty and revision hip arthroplasty with DELTA Multihole TT cup.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of HHS score equal or greater than "Good" at 2 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiographic implant evaluation and stability assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Migration over 2 mm or over 5 degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients recovery at 2 years after surgery evaluated using the 5-level EQ-5D version (EQ-5D-5L).
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L consists of the EQ-5D descriptive system and the EQ visual analogue scale (EQ VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of device-related Adverse Events / Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, Week 6, Week 12, Month 6, Month 12, Month 24

intervention.description: complex primary total hip arthroplasty or revision total hip arthroplasty performed through anterolateral or posterolateral approach

study_pop.textblock: Study participants will be selected from patients who underwent a Total Hip Arthroplasty with the DELTA Multihole TT cup. Both complex primary and revision cases are considered.

facility.name: 2nd University Department of Orthopaedic and Trauma Surgery Comenius University Faculty of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Boris Steno MD PhD Assoc Prof
